content: 125 k6 p1 7 84 126 k1 ssk k2tog k1 p1 5 60 127 k4 p1 5 60 128 cable 2 2 p1 5 60 stuffing at this point add stuffing to your pumpkin it should be moderately squishy to allow for shaping later 129 k2 k2tog p1 4 48 130 k3 p1 4 48 131 ssk k1 p1 3 36 132 slip 1 st onto cable needle and hold behind k1 slip_stitch from cable 2 24 needle back to left needle ssk 133 k2 2 24 134 k2tog 1 12 page 3 of 4 shaping to shape pumpkin use a crochet hook or darning needle to weave a long strand of yarn between opposite segments of the pumpkin loose ends should be external to the pumpkin with the yarn inside bisecting the opening run loose yarn along the two opposite sides of the pumpkin between cables and tie underneath the pumpkin for extra stability weave the loose yarn under a few stitches along the middle of purl sections to keep it in place tie tightly so sections are distinct the pumpkin is now halved next do the same thing halfway between the first tie to quarter the pumpkin work your way around the pumpkin with 6 pieces of yarn until all segments are tied and distinct you may need to adjust tightness to make all sections even weave loose ends into the opening and sew closed stem instructions rounds 135-143 with brown yarn k12 around add stuffing to stem round 144 k2tog six times cast off weave brown yarn end in page 4 of 4
